## Primary Work Streams

::: incremental
1.  Novel [**Electronic Interventions**]{style="color:#0072CE"} for Neuropsychology.
2.  [**Data Driven**]{style="color:#0072CE"} approaches for evaluating [**Outcome Research**]{style="color:#0072CE"}.
3.  [**Data Tools**]{style="color:#0072CE"} (apps) to improve service efficiency and quality.
4.  Building [**Normative Data**]{style="color:#0072CE"} for neurological conditions.
:::

## Electronic Interventions

![Title slide of presentation delivered to North Staffs Combined Dragons Den 2023](images/front_slide.jpg){fig-align="left" width="356"}

::: notes
•Develop a digital self-help intervention for patients experiencing functional/dissociative symptoms.

•This would be a HTML first approach, providing accessible and informative psychological intervention to a patient user group who currently do not have provisions for treatment. 

•This would provide high-quality intervention that could be delivered through minimal clinician input by a junior clinician. 
:::

## Why is this Worth Doing?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
#### Patients:

-   Ease of access (any device).

-   Prompt digital access.

-   User-friendly interface.

-   Highly acceptable and limited stigma.

-   Expand language options.

-   Accessibility features.

-   Functionality.
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
#### Combined Healthcare:

-   Cost-effectiveness.

-   Engagement rates.

-   Sustainability.

-   Reduce waiting periods.
:::
:::

## What Will This Project Involve?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Junior clinician.

-   Guided self-help.

-   Modular based intervention package.

## Considerations

-   **Method:** Acceptability and Preliminary Effectiveness Design.

-   **Sample:** Neuropsychology and FND clinics (Stoke & Sheffield).

-   **Collaboration:**

    -   **Graphic Design:** North Staffs Combined Comms Team.

    -   **Expertise:** Research Networks at University of Sheffield.

    -   **Evaluation:** Assistant Psychologist & DClinPsy student.
